body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Rook fails to update/deploy the prometheus rule and service monitor

**Expected behavior:**
Rook should successfully detect service monitor & prometheus and update/deploy them accordingly.

**How to reproduce it:**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
1. Deploy rook onto kubernetes cluster and wait for all the pods to be up
2. Scale down the rook-ceph-operator to 0 replicas and then scale it up to 1 again
```
oc scale --replicas=0 deployment/<your deployment> -n <your project>
oc scale --replicas=1 deployment/<your deployment> -n <your project>
```
3. On checking the logs we find the errors as below. 

Rook operator logs

```
2019-12-17 10:09:08.057532 E | op-mgr: failed to enable service monitor. service monitor could not be enabled. failed to update servicemonitor. resource name may not be empty
W1217 10:09:08.059014       7 client_config.go:549] Neither --kubeconfig nor --master was specified.  Using the inClusterConfig.  This might not work.
2019-12-17 10:09:08.075615 E | op-mgr: failed to deploy prometheus rule. prometheus rule could not be deployed. failed to update prometheusRule. prometheusrules.monitoring.coreos.com "prometheus-ceph-v14-rules" is invalid: metadata.resourceVersion: Invalid value: 0x0: must be specified for an update

```



**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Fedora 30
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: AWS
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): rook: v1.1.4-27.gf20c056
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): ceph version 14.2.4
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): openshift-clients-4.2.2
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): OpenShift
title: Manager pod fails to update service monitor and deploy prometheus rule after rook-operator is restarted in the cluster.
